summary: Floyd J. Fithian is mentioned in several documents related to the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) staff payroll records and background checks. While the documents do not explicitly detail Fithian's role or involvement, his name appears in the context of HSCA staff payroll records and background checks. The documents primarily concern the postponement of Social Security numbers within HSCA staff payroll records to protect personal privacy. The documents also include correspondence, fingerprint analysis reports, and fingerprint cards related to background checks conducted on HSCA staff and applicants. The documents suggest that Fithian was likely a staff member or applicant associated with the HSCA.
